oai_dc:dc.dc:title: House Bill 805
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Entitled, "An act to alter and amend an act, passed May 3rd 1866," HB 805 was passed as an amendment to the "Act to limit the elective franchise" of 1866. The amendment upheld the franchise restrictions of the previous legislation, but extended voting rights to all elegible male citizens, 21 years and older. It also stipulated that African Americans be prohibited from holding public office or serving on juries.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: RG 60: General Assembly Bills, Petitions, Reports, Etc., 1790-present
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Reconstruction (U.S. history, 1865-1877)--Tennessee
